sample-isolation-and-treatment_sample_is: Sampling was carried out at the Bermuda Atlantic Time-series Study (BATS) station (31° 40. 1′N, 64° 7.9′W) at a depth of 10 m using 10-l Niskin bottles on 15 April 2008. A subsample of 2 l of unfiltered water was collected to measure in situ concentrations of Chla and total DMSP. To exclude eukaryotes and large particles, the remaining seawater was prefiltered by gravity through 3 μm pore-size polycarbonate filters (142 mm, Millipore, Billerica, MA, USA) using an inlet filtration system attached directly to the Niskin bottle. Water was dispensed into 20 l polycarbonate carboys and maintained in a temperature-controlled room in the dark at in situ  temperature for 3 h before beginning the experiment to allow time for adaptation to any DMSP released from the cells during filtration.
sequences_sequences_filtered: Exact duplicate reads (10.7% of total reads) were removed from the libraries.
sequences_sequences_predicted_genes: Known query genes related to DMSP and sulfur (S) metabolism were selected from the literature, using orthologs in three genomes representing major marine bacterioplankton groups
